results.title: Teenagers talk: getting through adolescence
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Sam Weiss
results.brief_description: Presents teenagers from various ethnic backgrounds commenting on the difficulties of being an adolescent. Uses animated sequences to visually express such topics as sex, parents, drugs, peer pressure, individuality, conformity, friendship and physical maturation.
results.description: Presents teenagers from various ethnic backgrounds commenting on the difficulties of being an adolescent. Uses animated sequences to visually express such topics as sex, parents, drugs, peer pressure, individuality, conformity, friendship and physical maturation.

results.title: Teenagers on trial
results.creator_credit: RKO Pathe Pictures and Frances Dinsmoor
results.brief_description: During the emergence of the “angry young man” stereotype in the 1950’s, this classroom film attempted to instruct the young on the evils of non-conformity and rebellion. By addressing such a complex issue in 8 minutes, the film’s main purpose was to promote discussion. Shows examples of various types of juvenile delinquency and makes a shallow attempt to illustrate some of the causes including crowded schools, negligent parents and tenement neighbourhoods.

results.title: Teenagers create an animated film
results.creator_credit: Centron Educational Films, Maurice Prather and Larry Eikleberry
results.brief_description: Documents the efforts of junior high school students in producing an animated film, “Gone with the antennas”. Shows the step-by-step process of how an animated film can be produced with a minimum of expense by a youthful group.

results.title: Teenage whiz kids
results.creator_credit: CBS News and Arthur Mokin Productions
results.brief_description:
A CBS News presentation, this film views some gifted children in Washington. Covers the following points regarding gifted children: early entry into tertiary education, emotional maturity, the attitudes of peers, parents, and teachers and the types of problems encountered with early entry to universities and the resultant support needed.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Teenage relationships
results.creator_credit: Coastline Community College, David P. Stone and Harry Ratner
results.brief_description:
Episode number 23 of Series “Time to grow”.
Since the beginning of this century changes in patterns of labour and consumption in the developed world have led to the emergence of a distinctive period of human social development we call being a “teenager”. The teenage years, which correspond to adolescent physical development, are a time in which older children begin to move away from relationships centred on their families and to develop strong relationships with their peers. The teenager’s move towards autonomy can often result in friction between themselves and their family and friends as they seek to define their place in the world, and as they come to terms with their sexual and emotional maturing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Coastline Community College, David P. Stone and Harry Ratner

results.title: Teenage pregnancy
results.creator_credit: Sterling Educational Films, Moreland-Latchford Productions, Joe Hayward and Hector Lemieux
results.brief_description: Shows the reaction of a family when one of the daughters reveals that she is pregnant. Presents the decisions to be made concerning both the mother-to-be and the coming child, ignoring the responsibility of the father and concentrating on the girl’s problem.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sterling Educational Films, Moreland-Latchford Productions, Joe Hayward and Hector Lemieux

results.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: the Movie (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Limelight Entertainment, Kim Dawson, Simon Fields, David Chan and Steve Barron
results.brief_description: The four baby turtles who strayed into radioactive waste and mutated to become human sized talking reptilians with a hearty appetite for pizzas and rock music were raised by the Japanese ninja master water rat Splinter in the sewers of New York City. Now the dreaded Shredder is recruiting teenagers to commit a wave of robberies which has the city in panic. So it’s up to the four fearless turtles to save the day with a little help from feisty TV reporter April. Cowabunga! Based on the comic-book creation of Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird.

results.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II: the secret of the ooze (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Gary Propper, Thomas K. Gray, Kim Dawson, David Chan and Michael Pressman
results.brief_description: The four hip superheroes Raphael, Leonardo, Michaelangelo and Donatello continue their bodacious adventures as they find a new sewer home and with the help of curvaceous TV reporter April O’Neil, Professor Jordon and Keno, the pizza delivery boy they battle the Foot gang and other mutant villains to discover their origins, to save New York and to keep the mutant-causing green ooze from falling into evil hands.
